block.p: Peggy Lyman, a former principal with the Martha Graham Dance Company, and Richard Roger Hayes, a retired executive with Dean Witter Reynolds, the former investment firm, were married yesterday at the First Congregational Church of Old Lyme, Conn. The Rev. Carleen R. Gerber officiated, with the Rev. David W. Good, a fellow Congregational minister, taking part.

Mrs. Hayes, 54, danced with the Graham troupe from 1973 to 1988 and was featured in works including ''Lamentation,'' ''Frontier'' and ''Acts of Light.'' She is a master instructor at the Martha Graham School of Contemporary Dance in New York and is restaging Graham's works for the Martha Graham Trust. The bride was a founder of the dance division of the Hartt School at the University of Hartford and was the director of the division from 2001 until December. She is a daughter of James L. Morner of Hamilton, Ohio, and the late Earlene Weeks Morner.

Mr. Hayes, 75, who retired in 1992 as an associate national sales director at Dean Witter Reynolds, is a director of William D. Witter, an investment advisory firm in New York. He graduated from Fordham University. He is a son of the late Margaret and John Hayes, who lived in Lake Success, N.Y.
The bride's two previous marriages ended in divorce. The bridegroom was a widower.
